s.text: "I write every night, five times a week, I try to do five hundred words a day."
But in fact he read all references to him and, though only out of sight, collected voraciously choice items.

His daily stimulant--"If you can call it that," he remarked to his partner and close friend, Harold Epison, "--the daily ingestion of poison I inflict on myself"--was what he referred to with some scorn as "the McCarthy page" in the morning's newspaper.
We don't know what the triumvirate that's in power now, Khrushchev, Bulganin--I continue to refer to it as a triumvirate though they executed Beria a week ago, good riddance.
